Thank you for your support of our schools, teachers, and most importantly, our students.

-Sallisaw Public Schools

It is with sadness we announce the passing of one of our dedicated and beloved cafeteria workers...

Edith Lincks (Edie) worked at Sallisaw High School cafeteria starting in August of 2000.

Edie passed away quietly in her home the morning of September 6th, 2017 at the age of 75.

Edie loved her job at SHS. She loved the kids she served and the ladies she worked with.

For the last few years we tried to encourage Edie to retire and enjoy her family and friends, but she felt that her "family and friends" were all here at Sallisaw High.

Funeral arrangements are pending at this time.

As you may have heard, a fallacious threat was placed earlier this afternoon at our high school. All procedures were followed to ensure the safety of both our students and staff. Upon investigation by local authorities it is determined that the threat is empty, therefore, classes resumed as normal.

Two phone calls were sent out from our SchoolReach automated message system to the parents of high school students. If you did NOT receive either call then it is because your contact information is not current at the high school office. To be sure that you receive messages from our message system, emergency or otherwise, please contact our high school office to update your telephone records.

Please, if you have any questions, comments, or concerns, contact Mr. Farmer at the Administration Building, 918.775.5544.

Communication is key and the safety of our students is our highest priority.

Thank you and Merry Christmas!
